name: Enhanced Desktop and Python Ecosystem
description: This parent feature encompasses tools and functionalities that enhance desktop accessibility and provide a comprehensive Python ecosystem for educational and scientific purposes. It includes essential accessibility features for desktop environments, tools tailored for Python classroom activities to support teaching and learning, and resources for scientific computing and analysis using Python.

name: Linux Enhanced Compatibility and Functionality Suite
description: A comprehensive suite of tools and features aimed at enhancing Linux system compatibility, functionality, and user experience across diverse domains. This suite integrates support for various development kits, multimedia environments, load balancing, resilient storage, file sharing, authentication mechanisms, and toolkit optimizations to tailor the platform for both enterprise-grade and desktop-oriented use cases.

name: Critical Path and Buildsystem Functionality
description: A comprehensive parent feature that encompasses all critical path-related functionalities and buildsystem elements across various Linux desktop environments, server configurations, install methods, and application utilities. This feature provides a unified framework for categorizing essential packages and tools necessary for maintaining the base system, managing builds, constructing deliverables, and supporting extended desktop-specific and server-specific functionalities. Additionally, it includes functionalities to extend graphical environments like Xfce, along with fundamental utilities and advanced tools like GNU Emacs.
children: Extra plugins for the Xfce panel

name: Linux General Purpose Environment
description: A comprehensive feature encompassing essential components, compatibility tools, software support, and development frameworks required to build, run, and maintain a Linux-based general-purpose computing environment. This feature covers base system installation, development libraries and headers, multimedia frameworks, cross-platform compatibility libraries, graphical session setup, language-specific libraries for Perl and Ruby, enterprise certificate management, and open-source relational database systems.

name: Linux System Feature Grouping
description: This parent feature encompasses a variety of Linux-related functionalities, package groups, and software components categorized based on their use case, functionality, or conflict resolution. It provides coverage for graphical interfaces, internet applications, database management, scientific tools, virtualization, and conflict handling for system installations across different Linux variants and repositories.

name: Desktop Environment and User Interface Features
description: This parent feature encompasses a variety of desktop environments, window managers, and user interface customizations available for Linux systems. It includes lightweight and feature-rich desktop environments, user experience platforms for phones and tablets, as well as standalone window managers and environment-specific applications. Covering a broad spectrum, from resource-efficient environments for low-end machines to user-friendly and elegant interfaces, this feature ensures flexibility and adaptability across different hardware and use cases.

name: Comprehensive Application Development and Platform Support
description: This parent feature encompasses a wide range of tools, libraries, and platform support packages necessary for developing and supporting applications across various frameworks, graphical environments, and platforms. It includes specialized development tools for .NET Core, authoring functionalities, and core development libraries. Additionally, it supports creating applications for GNOME, KDE Frameworks 5 and 6, Xfce, and the X Window System, as well as enabling virtual machine support and legacy font compatibility. This feature provides a unified foundation for diverse software development needs.

name: System Development, Networking, and Identity Infrastructure
description: Encompasses tools, libraries, and services required for system development, networking, and identity management. This parent feature integrates utilities for C and D development, directory services for network management, domain membership capabilities, network infrastructure, legacy server support, and mechanisms for high availability. It serves as a comprehensive suite for creating development environments, managing network identities, and providing essential server functionality for modern and legacy systems.

name: System Tools and Utilities Suite
description: A comprehensive collection of system tools, utilities, and frameworks designed to facilitate administration, hardware interaction, software development, and entertainment on a Linux environment. This parent feature encompasses tools for system management, user interface design, production, and specialized tools for hardware engineers, developers, and system administrators.

name: System Service Features
description: A comprehensive set of features that enable the system to provide various services and functionalities for networking, data sharing, printing, web hosting, email communication, and more. These features allow the system to act as a server or client to support operations like file sharing, name resolution, backup management, data communication, and resource printing. They cater to both local and remote service configurations, ensuring robust and versatile operating system capabilities.

name: Office and Productivity Ecosystem
description: A comprehensive feature encompassing diverse office suite and productivity tools with support across multiple desktop environments and specialized use cases. This includes standard office productivity suites such as LibreOffice, tailored office suites for desktop environments like LXDE, LXQt, Xfce, and Deepin, as well as specialized software collections like those aimed at robotics software development. The feature provides a unified abstraction for applications aimed at enabling document editing, spreadsheet creation, presentation design, and other productivity-related tasks.

name: Advanced System Tools and Utilities
description: This feature encompasses a comprehensive suite of tools and utilities designed to support advanced system management, performance optimization, security auditing, development, networking, and specialized computing. These tools cater to a variety of use cases, ranging from debugging and performance diagnostics to scientific computation, container management, and mainframe access, offering a robust environment for system administration, development, and troubleshooting.

name: Programming Language Support and Development Tools
description: This feature encompasses comprehensive support for programming languages and associated development environments targeting multiple platforms. It includes tools, libraries, and runtime environments necessary for working with various programming languages, enabling both the execution of prewritten programs and the development of new software. It covers support for functional, object-oriented, and scripting languages, as well as cross-compilation capabilities for different target systems.

name: Advanced Software and Tools Ecosystem
description: A comprehensive collection of specialized software, tools, and environments catering to diverse domains such as 3D printing, cloud computing, backup management, educational platforms, text editing, graphics design, input and font rendering, and cluster infrastructure. This feature consolidates all software-related functionalities required for development, management, and user experience enhancement across local and distributed infrastructures, offering reliable and versatile solutions.

name: Desktop Environment and Window Management
description: This feature provides a comprehensive suite of desktop environments and window management systems to cater to diverse user preferences and use cases. It includes support for both traditional X Window System environments and modern Wayland protocol-based compositions, offering a variety of tiling and stacking window managers. Users can choose lightweight or feature-rich options depending on their workflow, while additional packages enhance functionality for selected managers.

name: Web and Application Development Stack
description: A comprehensive suite of tools and frameworks designed to support the development and deployment of modern web and application software. This feature covers essential development environments, scripting languages, web application frameworks, and application servers to ensure a robust development ecosystem for developers and organizations.

name: Linux Product Core and Feature Support
description: This parent feature encompasses essential packages and functionalities required for various Linux product cores and specialized support features. It includes development tools, ostree support, and specific core packages tailored for diverse Linux product variants, such as the client, compute node, server, and workstation. Additionally, it integrates feature-specific requirements like PowerTools for development and ostree support for Atomic Host and Workstation to enable robust system configuration and deployment capabilities.

name: Enterprise Systems Management Suite
description: A comprehensive suite of tools and interfaces enabling centralized management and streamlined operation of enterprise systems. This suite facilitates centralized identity and access management, personal information organization, remote system management, virtualization tools, and remote access capabilities, ensuring optimal productivity, scalability, and ease of use for IT administrators and end-users across Linux platforms.

name: Database Management Systems and Tools
description: A comprehensive collection of database management system products and tools, including client and server software for relational database engines. This feature encompasses solutions for efficient data storage, retrieval, and manipulation, as well as connectivity and database interaction. The sub-features include Alibaba database products, MariaDB client and server software, and PostgreSQL client and server software to cater to diverse database management requirements and use cases.

name: Legacy System Compatibility
description: A comprehensive set of tools and mechanisms designed to ensure smooth migration from or interoperability with legacy UNIX and X Window System environments. This feature facilitates seamless integration, compatibility, and transition for users and applications relying on older UNIX and X Window System technologies, enabling their continued usage within modern Linux systems.

name: Comprehensive Virtualization and System Management
description: This parent feature encompasses a wide range of tools, utilities, and platform-specific packages needed for virtualization technologies and system administration tasks. It integrates virtualization host installations, client management tools, platform-specific drivers for various hypervisors, packaging utilities for Linux environments, and administration tools. This feature is tailored to streamline the deployment, management, and interaction with containerized and virtualized environments across diverse platforms and use cases.

name: Desktop Environment and Virtualization Features
description: This parent feature encompasses a wide range of components and tools designed for Linux desktop environments and virtualization scenarios, including commonly used applications for various desktop environments, additional modules for enhanced functionality, localization features, and support for virtualized environments. It is organized to provide streamlined user experiences across different desktop environments while ensuring compatibility and usability within virtualized settings.
children: Extra games for the GNOME Desktop

name: Development and Virtualization Tooling Suite
description: This feature encompasses a collection of packages aimed at providing tools for professional design, software development, and virtualization environments. It integrates support for both headless and graphical virtualization setups, development components for LibreOffice, and provisioning tools like Vagrant with libvirt provider support. The suite is tailored to cater to professional designers, developers, and system administrators seeking a comprehensive toolkit for their workflows.

name: KDE Ecosystem
description: The KDE Ecosystem encompasses a comprehensive suite of components that provide a cohesive experience for users within the KDE environment. This parent feature includes the KDE Plasma Workspaces for desktop environments, KDE Educational applications tailored for learning purposes, KDE Office applications for productivity tasks, and the KDE Spin Initial Setup packages for first-time system configuration.
